page.title: 04SCHOOL LIFE IN SANDHURST
page.content: A SMALL VILLAGE SCHOOL We spoke to 5 fourth year pupils of Sandhurst Primary School,Rachel Cobb, Victoria Clarke, Cathy Austin, Michael Dennis and Christopher Wood. They all live in Sandhurst and travel to school by bike, car or on foot. The school has 22 pupils: 16 juniors and 6 infants. The staff consists of the Headmistress, 1 half-time teacher, 1 infant teacher, 2 dinner supervisors and 1 cleaner. School starts at 9am and finishes at 3pm. They have normal lessons and particularly like art and reading. There is a uniform but the regulations are not strict. The uniform colour is green. The children are very well organised and all age groups play together at break and lunchtime. Their favourite game seems to be rounders. In class older pupils help the younger ones.
